Sentencas: Miniaturized solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), whose designs are compatible with conventional semiconductor fabrication technology, are considered from a theoretical point of view given their distinctive electrode and electrolyte geometries.
Titulo: Electrodes and electrolytes in micro-SOFCs: a discussion of geometrical constraints

Sentencas: Micro-SOFCs may be operated in either a single-chamber mode for which both electrodes are located on one side of a thin film electrolyte or in the more conventional two-chamber mode, in which electrodes are located on opposite sides of the electrolyte.
Titulo: Electrodes and electrolytes in micro-SOFCs: a discussion of geometrical constraints

Sentencas: The electrode geometries and film thicknesses necessary to achieve sufficiently low polarization resistances are evaluated for the single-chamber micro-SOFC.
Titulo: Electrodes and electrolytes in micro-SOFCs: a discussion of geometrical constraints

Sentencas: Interdigitated (comb-like) electrodes with characteristic feature sizes of a few micrometers are found to be essential to insure low polarization resistance.
Titulo: Electrodes and electrolytes in micro-SOFCs: a discussion of geometrical constraints

Sentencas: Requirements with respect to electrochemical properties of the electrodes are addressed as well.
Titulo: Electrodes and electrolytes in micro-SOFCs: a discussion of geometrical constraints

Sentencas: Numerical calculations are used to examine the correlation between decreasing electrolyte film thickness and ohmic polarization in two-chamber fuel cells.
Titulo: Electrodes and electrolytes in micro-SOFCs: a discussion of geometrical constraints

Sentencas: Current constriction at electrode particles or three phase boundaries render very low film thicknesses (below say 300 nm) not very sensible.
Titulo: Electrodes and electrolytes in micro-SOFCs: a discussion of geometrical constraints
